header.description: The most advanced background image extension for VSCode
description: Add multiple background images for the window, editors, sidebars, or the panel. Load backgrounds from file, [glob]({0}), or URL. Transition between multiple background images.
installation.description:
- Install from the [Visual Studio Marketplace]({0}).
 - Install directly from VSCode using the id {1}.
installation.usage.description:
1. Type `Background: Configuration` in the command pallette or press the **Background** tab in the statusbar.
 2. Select where you want to add a background (Window, Editor, Sidebar, Panel).
 3. Add backgrounds and change how it should be displayed.
 4. Use `Background: Install` or press the install button.
features.multiple_backgrounds.descriptio: Add background images for the whole window, editors, sidebars, or the panel. Transition between multiple background images.
features.configuration.description: Type `Background: Configuration` in the command pallette or press the **Background** tab in the statusbar to access the configuration menu.
features.path._: Glob, URL, and Environment Variable Support
features.path.description:
Add background images by file, folder, [glob]({0}), or URL.

> ⚠️ **Use only `/` for directories**
>
> [node-glob]({1}) only accepts `/` as path separators, `\` is reserved for escape characters.
configuration.description:
Use the `Background: Configuration` command to access the configuration menu.

Background properties are saved as arrays so you can have different options for different UI elements.

The order settings are saved in is:

 0. Window
 1. Editor
 2. Sidebar
 3. Panel
license: This extension is released under the {0}.
help.corrupt.description:
This warning may appear after running the uninstall command, reopen VSCode for this to disappear.

If this warning still appears after an uninstall, reinstall [VSCode]({0}).
help.fix.description:
This extension modifies an internal file to make backgrounds work, if VSCode stops working replace `{0}` with `{1}`.

This extension also modifies `{2}`, replace with `{3}` if VSCode stops working.
help.missing.description: The workspace setting will use whatever settings are set for that workspace, it does not fallback to the global setting.
help.inverted.description: As of 3.0.0, opacity has been switched from 0 visible and 1 invisible to 1 visible and 0 invisible, use the **useInvertedOpacity** option if you want the old behavior.
help.uninstall.description: Backgrounds are not removed on extension disable or uninstall, you must run the **Background: Uninstall** command to remove backgrounds.
help.window._: Background doesn't work on window buttons (minimize/maximize/close) {0}
help.window.description: These buttons are controlled by the system and not VSCode; and can not be modified by this extension.
help.wsl.description: Backgrounds can not be changed while running this extension in a remote WSL window. Backgrounds must be changed by making changes in the main VSCode window, then opening the remote WSL window.
help.readonly.description:
This extension doesn't natively support Mac, write permissions must be granted to the VSCode application:

1. Move `{0}` from `{1}` to the `{2}` directory.
2. Run `{3}` to grant write permissions.
help.snap.description: Applications installed using [snap]({0}) are inherently read-only, install VSCode using [deb]({1}) or [rpm]({1}).
